New York University    Skip to Content   Skip to Search   Skip to Sub Navigation              Global Institute of Public Health                       Search NYU                    Pages |    People                                                                Bread Crumbs          Global Institute of Public Health   /   Academic Programs   /   Master of Public Health   /   Academics   /   Courses                       Sub Navigation                                 Public Health Core Courses                       Concentration Courses                       Public Health Electives                       Culminating Experience                       MPH Course Syllabi                       Online Courses                                                                 Public Health Electives      The NYU MPH curriculum includes elective requirements to enhance individual learning plans. Elective courses can be used to provide greater depth in an area of interest, explore new public health concepts or gain additional skill sets. Below are elective courses open to all MPH students who have met identified prerequisite requirements. Students may take electives within his/her area of concentration or outside of it. With advisor approval, MPH students may also select a graduate level course outside of the MPH program, taking advantage of the rich academic offerings across the university. Students work with their advisor in selecting elective courses based on individualized professional and educational needs. Abroad    Admitted Students                                     Community Public Health: International Community Health (HCPH/IPH-MPH) - Master of Public Health Program            New York University has united the NYU Steinhardt School Community Public Health and Global Public Health programs into an even stronger, fully-accredited Master of Public Health ( NYU MPH ). The newly consolidated NYU MPH includes three concentrations: Community and International Health, Public Health Nutrition, and Global Health Leadership. The NYU MPH is a university-wide degree program and is no longer a part of the Steinhardt School of Culture, Education, and Human Development.    For information regarding this program and how to apply, please visit the NYU MPH website at: http://mph.nyu.edu                        This site, and all its contents, are Copyright ©        by New York University. All rights reserved.    Steinhardt School of Culture, Education, and Human Development - 82 Washington Square East, New York, NY 10003

Elective courses can be used to provide greater depth in an area of interest, explore new public health concepts or gain additional skill sets. Below are elective courses open to all MPH students who have met identified prerequisite requirements. Students may take electives within his/her area of concentration or outside of it. With advisor approval, MPH students may also select a graduate level course outside of the MPH program, taking advantage of the rich academic offerings across the university. Students work with their advisor in selecting elective courses based on individualized professional and educational needs. Abroad    Admitted Students                                     Community Public Health: International Community Health (HCPH/IPH-MPH) - Master of Public Health Program            New York University has united the NYU Steinhardt School Community Public Health and Global Public Health programs into an even stronger, fully-accredited Master of Public Health ( NYU MPH ). The newly consolidated NYU MPH includes three concentrations: Community and International Health, Public Health Nutrition, and Global Health Leadership. The NYU MPH is a university-wide degree program and is no longer a part of the Steinhardt School of Culture, Education, and Human Development.    For information regarding this program and how to apply, please visit the NYU MPH website at: http://mph.nyu.edu                        This site, and all its contents, are Copyright ©        by New York University. NYU's strength in public health draws from the robust collaboration taking place across its renowned schools and colleges, fostering a truly interdisciplinary approach to addressing our most pressing global health challenges.
